channel.title: jsorge.net
channel.description: Christian, husband, dad, developer, batman afficianado.

item.content:encoded:
Netflix should release ‚ÄúVHS Mode‚Äù, where watching the same content over and over and over again would degrade the picture over time and eventually snap the tape.

I say this as a parent of boys who are currently on their 1,432nd viewing of the Sarah and Duck show. Make it stop!
A 104.5 temperature is high, right?

This is completely wild. I have an iPhone that's tethered to my laptop. My laptop is creating a wireless network, which the phone is joined to. And I'm still able to proxy my phone through the laptop using Charles. How does this voodoo work??

ü§Ø
I want to take some Markdown text and convert it to HTML, on Linux and calling it from a Vapor 3 project written in Swift. How would I go about doing this?
I should have done just a little more digging before posting, and I would have found this great library that uses cmark under the hood.
I don‚Äôt know much about hockey. But I‚Äôm watching the first game of the Stanley Cup Finals and the score is currently 5-4. Isn‚Äôt that really high?
Dang, I thought I had my Swift Playground woes fixed in Xcode 9.3.1. But alas, I'm getting the never ending running with this one. I'm just trying to parse a text file!
Note to self: instead of tweeting about a crazy linter rule at work, petition to have it changed. Make the codebase better rather than whine about it on the interwebs.

I got recommended to try Caddy instead of nginx. I think I have a setup starting to work, but need to figure out how to proxy something from one container to the machine's localhost, and have that display using the machine's port.

item.title: Rebuilding taphouse.io
item.content:encoded: New post from jsorge.net: [Rebuilding taphouse.io](http://jsorge.local/2018/05/22/rebuilding-taphouse-io
1Password v7 for the Mac is out today! You should go get it. I've been on the beta for a while now and it's fantastic.
Madness is not being able to find out how nginx is serving localhost:8080 when it‚Äôs not running and nothing is bound to port 8080.

I'm going to call this a successful end to the night: I just got the taphouse.io site running locally in Docker, and could hit it via localhost.

Next is to get it behind nginx locally, which is proving a harder challenge.
New post from jsorge.net: Rebuilding taphouse.io

I may have hit the point of searching out too much documentation and tutorials for Docker. But I‚Äôm nearing the mental place to be able to understand that a container does not always equal a repo. That has been a mental block for me.

Phase 1 of my taphouse.io rewrite accomplished: Vapor is complete!

Next up is Docker, Nginx, and actual hosting on a server at Digital Ocean.
New post from jsorge.net: http://jsorge.local/2018/05/19/ive-had-to

I stumbled upon this amazing resource to help you learn a language or tool in a short amount of time.

It's a great reference for getting started on something unfamiliar.
New post from jsorge.net: http://jsorge.local/2018/05/17/the-money-ive

Thanks to @twostraws's Vapor book I found that I needed to register a middleware to handle stuff in the public folder. Once that was in my images and styles loaded instantly.

üéâüéâüéâ

Back at my Vapor 3 conversion for taphouse.io. I got the leaf errors figured out. üéâ

Next to get my assets linking properly in the Public folder.
vapor rum. It could be a long evening. At least the boys upstairs aren't screaming anymore.

Tonight's project after the boys go to bed: Get my taphouse.io site up and running in Vapor 3 on a local Docker container. Extra credit will be given out if I'm able to also add nginx, and even more credit still if I can get it running on a server. Stay tuned.
The days when I find something to write (even a short journal or microblog post) are days when I feel better. I don't know why that is.
I‚Äôm calling it a night. Feeling somewhat defeated by these leaf templates. But I‚Äôll figure it out. Eventually I‚Äôll finish one of these side projects.
I love Ichiro. He‚Äôs probably the only front office guy in baseball who would be out on the field celebrating an extra innings walk off win dresses in full uniform and batting gloves.

I had the site running on Vapor 2 last year. I'm just trying to update to 3 and the Leaf templating system is throwing errors I didn't see before. So I've gotta fix those before adapting for Docker. I don't expect even full credit at this point.
After 30 minutes of screaming, the boys are in bed, I've got an Old Fashioned, and I'm ready to tackle Vapor 3.
Yup. My boys clogged a Froggy Potty.
Thor Ragnarok is an incredibly rewatchable movie. Just so much fun.
Just saw that James Paxton threw a no hitter in Toronto. Way to go Big Maple! Go Mariners!

It‚Äôs getting increasingly common for us to go wake Atticus from nap and find him wearing a shirt for pants, having put his legs through the arms. I wonder if this kid just really wants skinny jeans?!
On the phone with a senior Apple technical support guy and he did screen sharing with my iPhone. Never seen that before, but it's pretty cool.

item.title: My First Swift Package
item.content:encoded: New post from jsorge.net: [My First Swift Package](http://jsorge.local/2018/05/07/my-first-swift-package
I'm wanting to get into scripting a bit more, and this new trick from Brett Terpstra will be a great way to spin up something new to try out.
New post from jsorge.net: http://jsorge.local/2018/05/07/im-super-sad
New post from jsorge.net: My First Swift Package
Mariners walk off! What a game!

I'm writing a little thing that will take my markdown files and make them textbundles and want to embed images in the bundle.

Is a regular expression the best way to get any image names from that file?
I just realized I've been a 1Password customer for 10 years now. It's easily in my pantheon of apps I couldn't live without.
Star Wars in the style of Arrested Development is the video we all need to see today.

Sad day: My Fluid app for GitHub is considered an ‚Äúold browser" and is starting to break on me. I emailed the developer of Fluid and hope to get a good response, but it hasn't been updated in so long that I'm not optimistic.

Any other good way to silo a web app on the Mac?
Ok, I got the site working locally. Victory! Next would be porting over my Ghost template to Jekyll. That's a battle for another day.

I'm trying to get a Jekyll instance running locally and I keep running into Ruby and Gems issues. I've only used Ruby for Cocoapods and the Gems concept is all new to me. Maybe this isn't the blog engine for me.

item.title: View Controllers Make Crummy Navigators
item.content:encoded: New post from jsorge.net: [View Controllers Make Crummy Navigators](http://jsorge.local/2018/05/02/view-controllers-make-crummy-navigators
The only reason it's not insane for parents to pick up after their kids day after day after day is that they don't expect different results.

Reminder to my future self: setting the delegate property on a UINavigationController subclass doesn't always do what I think it will do. In the case of the MFMessageComposeViewController, I needed to set the messageComposeDelegate instead.
New post from jsorge.net: View Controllers Make Crummy Navigators

I'm having this really weird and aggravating problem where some Apple Music songs will not play on my iPhone X but they will play on other devices. Hoping Apple's support can get to the bottom of it. I‚Äôve restarted the phone a few times to no avail.
I've totally bought in on the Shaquem Griffin hype train. I'm stoked to see him in Seattle. Go Hawks!
